inlineContent.text: It is important to close the client instance, for example in a defer statement, after use to cleanly shutdown the underlying NIO

Shuts down the client and event loop gracefully. This function is clearly an outlier in that it uses a completion
callback instead of an EventLoopFuture. The reason for that is that NIOâ€™s EventLoopFutures will call back on an event loop.
The virtue of this function is to shut the event loop down. To work around that we call back on a DispatchQueue
